radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the head
radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild, scattered white-matter changes predominantly in the periventricular and subcortical regions, and in the midbrain region indicating chronic microangiopathic disease.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On day 3, new, progressive, hyperintense punctate and linear cortical and subcortical foci bilaterally were observed, some with restricted diffusion suggestive of infarction. A follow-up MRI on day 6 revealed a new punctate focus of restricted diffusion in the right pons, diffuse hyperintense signal in the cerebellar vermis bilaterally, with previously noted findings being unchanged or slightly less conspicuous.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the head
radiographic_examinations.findings: Numerous new punctate cerebellar infarcts without susceptibility changes suggestive of microhemorrhage.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed tomography (CT) of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Atelectasis and cholelithiasis but no evidence of cholecystitis.
